bwwExcerpt: Pascal and Valli are both superb vocalists, and have charm to spare, but the structure of this musical too often eschews their stage time together in favor of chorus numbers and side plots. As lovers, Edward and Vivian don't even have a duet until the penultimate number. When the pair does sing - separately - about the central relationship, the songs have been written in the plain language of pop by Adams and Vallance.
